<a id="class_Texture2D"></a>

# Texture2D

**Inherits:** [Texture](class_texture.md) **<** [Resource](class_resource.md) **<** [RefCounted](class_refcounted.md) **<** [Object](class_object.md)

**Inherited By:** [AnimatedTexture](class_animatedtexture.md), [AtlasTexture](class_atlastexture.md), [CameraTexture](class_cameratexture.md), [CanvasTexture](class_canvastexture.md), [CompressedTexture2D](class_compressedtexture2d.md), [CurveTexture](class_curvetexture.md), [CurveXYZTexture](class_curvexyztexture.md), [DPITexture](class_dpitexture.md), [ExternalTexture](class_externaltexture.md), [GradientTexture1D](class_gradienttexture1d.md), [GradientTexture2D](class_gradienttexture2d.md), [ImageTexture](class_imagetexture.md), [MeshTexture](class_meshtexture.md), [NoiseTexture2D](class_noisetexture2d.md), [PlaceholderTexture2D](class_placeholdertexture2d.md), [PortableCompressedTexture2D](class_portablecompressedtexture2d.md), [Texture2DRD](class_texture2drd.md), [ViewportTexture](class_viewporttexture.md)

Texture for 2D and 3D.

<!-- classref-introduction-group -->

## Description

A texture works by registering an image in the video hardware, which then can be used in 3D models or 2D [Sprite2D](class_sprite2d.md) or GUI [Control](class_control.md).

Textures are often created by loading them from a file. See [@GDScript.load()](class_@gdscript.md#class_@GDScript_method_load).

\ **Texture2D** is a base for other resources. It cannot be used directly.

\ **Note:** The maximum texture size is 16384Ã—16384 pixels due to graphics hardware limitations. Larger textures may fail to import.

<!-- classref-reftable-group -->

<!-- classref-descriptions-group -->

## Method Descriptions

<a id="class_Texture2D_private_method__draw"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **_draw**\ (\ to_canvas_item\: [RID](class_rid.md), pos\: [Vector2](class_vector2.md), modulate\: [Color](class_color.md), transpose\: [bool](class_bool.md)\ ) <span class="virtual">virtual</span> <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_Texture2D_private_method__draw)

Called when the entire **Texture2D** is requested to be drawn over a [CanvasItem](class_canvasitem.md), with the top-left offset specified in `pos`. `modulate` specifies a multiplier for the colors being drawn, while `transpose` specifies whether drawing should be performed in column-major order instead of row-major order (resulting in 90-degree clockwise rotation).

\ **Note:** This is only used in 2D rendering, not 3D.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_Texture2D_private_method__draw_rect"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **_draw_rect**\ (\ to_canvas_item\: [RID](class_rid.md), rect\: [Rect2](class_rect2.md), tile\: [bool](class_bool.md), modulate\: [Color](class_color.md), transpose\: [bool](class_bool.md)\ ) <span class="virtual">virtual</span> <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_Texture2D_private_method__draw_rect)

Called when the **Texture2D** is requested to be drawn onto [CanvasItem](class_canvasitem.md)'s specified `rect`. `modulate` specifies a multiplier for the colors being drawn, while `transpose` specifies whether drawing should be performed in column-major order instead of row-major order (resulting in 90-degree clockwise rotation).

\ **Note:** This is only used in 2D rendering, not 3D.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_Texture2D_private_method__draw_rect_region"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **_draw_rect_region**\ (\ to_canvas_item\: [RID](class_rid.md), rect\: [Rect2](class_rect2.md), src_rect\: [Rect2](class_rect2.md), modulate\: [Color](class_color.md), transpose\: [bool](class_bool.md), clip_uv\: [bool](class_bool.md)\ ) <span class="virtual">virtual</span> <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_Texture2D_private_method__draw_rect_region)

Called when a part of the **Texture2D** specified by `src_rect`'s coordinates is requested to be drawn onto [CanvasItem](class_canvasitem.md)'s specified `rect`. `modulate` specifies a multiplier for the colors being drawn, while `transpose` specifies whether drawing should be performed in column-major order instead of row-major order (resulting in 90-degree clockwise rotation).

\ **Note:** This is only used in 2D rendering, not 3D.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_Texture2D_private_method__get_height"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[int](class_int.md) **_get_height**\ (\ ) <span class="virtual">virtual</span> <span class="required">required</span> <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_Texture2D_private_method__get_height)

Called when the **Texture2D**'s height is queried.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<!-- classref-method -->

[int](class_int.md) **_get_width**\ (\ ) <span class="virtual">virtual</span> <span class="required">required</span> <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_Texture2D_private_method__get_width)

Called when the **Texture2D**'s width is queried.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](class_bool.md) **_has_alpha**\ (\ ) <span class="virtual">virtual</span> <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_Texture2D_private_method__has_alpha)

Called when the presence of an alpha channel in the **Texture2D** is queried.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_Texture2D_private_method__is_pixel_opaque"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](class_bool.md) **_is_pixel_opaque**\ (\ x\: [int](class_int.md), y\: [int](class_int.md)\ ) <span class="virtual">virtual</span> <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_Texture2D_private_method__is_pixel_opaque)

Called when a pixel's opaque state in the **Texture2D** is queried at the specified ``(x, y)`` position.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<!-- classref-method -->

Creates a placeholder version of this resource ([PlaceholderTexture2D](class_placeholdertexture2d.md)).

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_Texture2D_method_draw"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **draw**\ (\ canvas_item\: [RID](class_rid.md), position\: [Vector2](class_vector2.md), modulate\: [Color](class_color.md) = Color(1, 1, 1, 1), transpose\: [bool](class_bool.md) = false\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_Texture2D_method_draw)

Draws the texture using a [CanvasItem](class_canvasitem.md) with the [RenderingServer](class_renderingserver.md) API at the specified `position`.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_Texture2D_method_draw_rect"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **draw_rect**\ (\ canvas_item\: [RID](class_rid.md), rect\: [Rect2](class_rect2.md), tile\: [bool](class_bool.md), modulate\: [Color](class_color.md) = Color(1, 1, 1, 1), transpose\: [bool](class_bool.md) = false\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_Texture2D_method_draw_rect)

Draws the texture using a [CanvasItem](class_canvasitem.md) with the [RenderingServer](class_renderingserver.md) API.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_Texture2D_method_draw_rect_region"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

`void` **draw_rect_region**\ (\ canvas_item\: [RID](class_rid.md), rect\: [Rect2](class_rect2.md), src_rect\: [Rect2](class_rect2.md), modulate\: [Color](class_color.md) = Color(1, 1, 1, 1), transpose\: [bool](class_bool.md) = false, clip_uv\: [bool](class_bool.md) = true\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_Texture2D_method_draw_rect_region)

Draws a part of the texture using a [CanvasItem](class_canvasitem.md) with the [RenderingServer](class_renderingserver.md) API.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_Texture2D_method_get_height"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[int](class_int.md) **get_height**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_Texture2D_method_get_height)

Returns the texture height in pixels.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_Texture2D_method_get_image"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Image](class_image.md) **get_image**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_Texture2D_method_get_image)

Returns an [Image](class_image.md) that is a copy of data from this **Texture2D** (a new [Image](class_image.md) is created each time). [Image](class_image.md)\ s can be accessed and manipulated directly.

\ **Note:** This will return ``null`` if this **Texture2D** is invalid.

\ **Note:** This will fetch the texture data from the GPU, which might cause performance problems when overused. Avoid calling [get_image()](class_texture2d.md#class_Texture2D_method_get_image) every frame, especially on large textures.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_Texture2D_method_get_size"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[Vector2](class_vector2.md) **get_size**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_Texture2D_method_get_size)

Returns the texture size in pixels.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_Texture2D_method_get_width"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[int](class_int.md) **get_width**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_Texture2D_method_get_width)

Returns the texture width in pixels.

<hr class="classref-item-separator">

<a id="class_Texture2D_method_has_alpha"></a>

<!-- classref-method -->

[bool](class_bool.md) **has_alpha**\ (\ ) <span class="const">const</span> [ðŸ”—](#class_Texture2D_method_has_alpha)

Returns ``true`` if this **Texture2D** has an alpha channel.
